title: Trump says more tariff letters coming, warns no extension beyond August 1
content: Donald Trump announced new tariffs on foreign imports. These tariffs will be effective from August 1, 2025. He stated no further extensions would be granted. Letters outlining tariffs have been sent to various countries. These countries include Japan, South Korea and others. The tariffs range from 25 to 40 percent. This is unless trade deals are reached before the deadline.

title: India eyes rare earths from Australia; move to counter China’s export curbs
content: India and Australia are engaged in discussions regarding rare earth minerals, prompted by global concerns over potential supply shortages due to China's export restrictions. These talks extend to copper, with interest from both private and public sectors in India, particularly given existing smelter capacity and investments. China's dominance in magnet processing significantly impacts India's automotive and white goods industries.

title: Street protests against Pak-backed terrorists good sign for peace in J&K: LG
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha emphasized that peace and security are paramount for tourism development in Jammu and Kashmir. He noted the growing public opposition to terrorism, signaling a desire for peace and progress.

title: Rocket shocker: US Air Force halts SpaceX project; Reason same as why Musk skipped omelette …
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: Young Indian-AJL transaction a sham: ASG in Herald case
content: Additional solicitor general SV Raju argued in a Delhi court that the transaction between Associated Journals Ltd and Young Indian Pvt Ltd was a sham. He alleged a criminal breach of trust, claiming that funds given to the All India Congress Committee were misused. The court has scheduled further proceedings for July 12.

title: 'In every generation, you will find players': Ganguly 'not surprised' by Gill's heroics
content: Sourav Ganguly believes Shubman Gill, currently thriving as India's Test captain, will face increasing pressure. He highlighted the continuous emergence of talent in Indian cricket, citing Gill's phenomenal form and record-breaking potential. Ganguly emphasized the importance of a fresh start at Lord's and suggested a lively pitch would favor India's chances of securing 20 wickets.

title: Trump reiterates warning! Brics countries to be charged 10% additional tariffs
content: US President Trump has warned BRICS nations, including India, of a potential 10% tariff, alleging the bloc aims to weaken the US dollar. He asserted that India's BRICS membership makes it subject to these tariffs, dismissing any exceptions.

title: Trump’s message to Musk: US prez pens long note; ‘Saddened to see Elon go completely …’
content: Donald Trump has publicly criticised Elon Musk for his plan to form a new political party, dubbed the 'American Party,' expressing disappointment and describing Musk's recent behaviour as a 'train wreck.' Trump opposes third parties, citing potential chaos, and suggests Musk's actions stem from the elimination of the Electric Vehicle Mandate in a recently passed bill, despite Musk's prior endorsement.

title: Trump dodges question on Jeffrey Epstein case; calls reporter 'waste of time'
content: President Trump dismissed a reporter's question about the Jeffrey Epstein case, deeming it a waste of time amidst pressing issues like the Texas flood and Operation Midnight Hammer's success. This occurred after Elon Musk's accusations linking Trump to the Epstein files, which Trump refuted with a statement from Epstein's former lawyer.

title: After Kohli and Pant, another Indian cricket heavyweight stars at Wimbledon - see pics
content: Following Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's appearances, another cricketing icon joined the list of Indian cricket stars at Wimbledon. Rishabh Pant, Deepak Chahar, and Jaya Bhardwaj were also spotted, adding to the growing trend of Indian athletes attending the prestigious tournament alongside global sporting icons. Earlier, David Beckham and John Cena were also spotted in the Royal Box.

title: Former NHL enforcer Nick Tarnasky destroys drunk man in viral golf course brawl
content: A recent viral video shows former NHL enforcer Nick Tarnasky physically confronting a drunk man during a heated altercation at a Canadian golf course. After repeated warnings, Tarnasky throws the man into a lake and lands a series of punches when the aggressor returns for more. The incident has sparked widespread attention online.

title: Bill Gates out of world’s 10 richest man list: His net worth falls 30% in 7 days
content: Bill Gates has fallen out of the top ten richest people due to a recalculation reflecting his significant charitable donations. His net worth decreased by $52 billion, moving him to twelfth place, while Steve Ballmer, his former assistant and Microsoft's ex-CEO, now ranks higher with $172 billion.

title: Cues from Lord's nets: Why Gill and Pant skipped training; Bumrah's final touches
content: Following a travel day from Birmingham, India's cricket team held an optional practice session at Lord's Cricket Ground. Key players like Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant were absent, while Jasprit Bumrah, returning for the third Test, bowled extensively and worked on his batting. The team, buoyed by their Edgbaston victory, aims to capitalise on Bumrah's return and the bowlers' form.

title: Key material for Pulwama attack bought on Amazon: FATF report
content: The FATF highlights the increasing use of e-commerce and online payment platforms for terrorist financing, citing the Pulwama attack and Gorakhnath Temple incident. State-sponsored terrorism is identified as a significant concern, with nations providing financial and logistical support to terrorist organizations.

title: Dayton Bramhall cut again — legacy Disney daughter’s emotional Netflix journey
content: Dayton Bramhall, daughter of Shelly, faced challenges in her DCC journey. She auditioned thrice but was cut each time. Despite her family's DCC legacy, she needed to earn her place. The rejection strained relationships, especially with her mother. Dayton now teaches at The Young Company in Texas. She empowers young dancers with her experiences.

title: Colin Kaepernick: 'I'm not quitting'—daily training for NFL comeback
content: Colin Kaepernick, now 37, declares his readiness to return to the NFL after an eight-year absence. Despite last playing in 2017, he maintains a rigorous training schedule and believes he can still be a starting quarterback. Kaepernick awaits an opportunity, remaining optimistic that the right team will call, even after years away from the game.

title: 'He got tired of that BBL smell': Cardi B deletes Stefon Diggs pics; fans slam rapper
content: Cardi B has sparked breakup rumors with Stefon Diggs by deleting all their photos together from her Instagram. Just weeks after their romantic getaways, including a stay in a French castle, fans noticed the sudden disappearance of Diggs from her social media. A cryptic post from Paris further fueled speculation, leaving fans wondering if the whirlwind romance is over.

title: Trump tariffs: How Xi still 'mines' the advantage - and holds 'critical' key
content: US President Trump imposed tariffs on imports from Japan and South Korea. China faces import restrictions. China dominates critical mineral production. The US relies on China for rare earth imports. China weaponized its dominance by placing strategic minerals under export control. China retains price-setting power. China's export controls triggered a plunge in rare earth magnet exports.

title: After Kohli, Indian pacer shines alongside partner at Wimbledon - pic inside
content: Wimbledon 2025 has become a star-studded affair, drawing sporting icons from around the globe. Indian cricketer like Deepak Chahar, along with his wife Jaya Bhardwaj have become the most recent duo to turn heads at the Grand Slam. Recently, pictures of Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma in the Royal Box had gone viral.

title: Excessive burping could mean more than a full stomach—all you need to know
content: Excessive burping, or belching, is a natural bodily function but can also signal underlying health issues like GERD, indigestion, or H. Pylori infection. Swallowing air while eating or drinking quickly, consuming carbonated beverages, or smoking are common causes. Lifestyle adjustments such as eating slowly and avoiding certain foods can help reduce excessive burping.

title: Green tinge, slope and the Lord's: India batters set for their 'first' England challenge
content: Ahead of India's Lord's Test, the pitch is expected to favor bowlers, especially in the initial sessions, with more life than previous matches. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak noted the green tinge and potential for low first-innings scores. The iconic Lord's slope presents a unique challenge, requiring batsmen to adjust their technique to counter the ball's movement.

title: Centre flays X over 'censorship' claim, says platform delayed unblocking accounts
content: India has refuted X's claims that it ordered the blocking of international news channels like @Reuters and @ReutersWorld. The ministry of electronics and information technology clarified that it promptly requested X to unblock the accounts when they were initially restricted. The government criticized X for the delay in restoring access, emphasizing that it took over 21 hours despite continuous follow-ups.

title: Milan airport horror: Man dies after being sucked into aircraft's engine
content: A man, believed to be around 35, tragically died after being sucked into a plane engine at Milan Bergamo Airport. He breached security, accessing the aircraft parking zones after abandoning his car near the terminal. Authorities have confirmed he was neither a passenger nor airport staff.

title: Exclusive | 'I became India No. 1 but wasn’t serious professionally': 16-year-old Tanvi
content: Sixteen-year-old Tanvi Sharma, a badminton player from Punjab, made history at the US Open 2025, becoming the youngest Indian to reach a BWF World Tour Final. Despite losing to Beiwen Zhang, Sharma's impressive run, defeating higher-ranked opponents, inspires many. She balances rigorous training with her studies, fueled by her mother's support.

title: Great Indian Kapil Show 3: Jaideep Ahlawat, Vijay Verma to grace the show
content: The Great Indian Kapil Show's season 2 continues its laughter riot with upcoming episode featuring Jaideep Ahlawat, Vijay Verma, Jeetendra Kumar, and Pratik Gandhi. Host Kapil Sharma's jokes about Jaideep's intimidating personality and Pratik's dry state appearance leave everyone in splits.

title: 'Violations of fundamental rights': ICC cracks down on Taliban; Supreme Leader named
content: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for Taliban leaders Haibatullah Akhundzada and Abdul Hakim Haqqani, accusing them of crimes against humanity. These warrants cite the systematic persecution of women, girls, and those defying the Taliban's gender policies in Afghanistan since August 2021. The ICC emphasizes the deprivation of fundamental rights and freedoms through discriminatory decrees and edicts.

title: Watch: What's brewing? Gambhir, India staff spotted in intense inspection of Lord's pitch
content: Ahead of the crucial Lord's Test, the green pitch has sparked intense speculation. Coach Gautam Gambhir and his staff meticulously analyzed the surface, hinting at a strategy favoring India's pace bowlers. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak acknowledged the green tinge, anticipating an advantage for pacers ahead of the 3rd Test on Thursday.

title: Watch: Philadelphia mass shooting caught on camera
content: A mass shooting in Philadelphia claimed the lives of Zahir Wylie, Jason Reese, and Azir Harris, while injuring ten others, including a 15-year-old girl. Surveillance footage captured multiple gunmen firing indiscriminately on South Etting Street. Police are investigating the incident, which occurred amidst a weekend of widespread violence across the city, leaving authorities and community leaders condemning the senseless act.

title: Kolkata gang rape case: Court sends 4 accused to 14-day judicial custody
content: Alipore Court remanded the four accused, including prime suspect Monojit Mishra, in the South Calcutta Law College gang rape case to 14 days of judicial custody. Kolkata Police's detective department is investigating discrepancies in the attendance register. Meanwhile, SFI activists protested outside a Howrah college, demanding action against TMCP leader Souvik Roy for allegedly mistreating first-year students.

title: Anand rates D Gukesh's Norway Chess showing: 'He deserved a D'
content: Despite a mixed run after his world championship win, Gukesh D showed resilience at Norway Chess, securing a notable victory against Magnus Carlsen. His long-time mentor, Viswanathan Anand, upgraded Gukesh's performance assessment, acknowledging his resourcefulness. Anand highlighted areas for improvement, particularly decision-making in games. Gukesh currently leads the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz Croatia 2025, demonstrating his ongoing competitive spirit.

title: Years of inaction, minutes of terror: Over 100 dead in Texas flood
content: Kerr County faces scrutiny after a devastating flash flood claimed over 100 lives during the Fourth of July weekend. A CNN investigation reveals the county's failure to implement basic emergency alert systems, despite repeated warnings and available funding. The lack of sirens and real-time communication with the National Weather Service contributed to the tragedy, prompting criticism of systemic inaction and avoidable loss of life.

title: 'Let them arrest me': Mah min defies own govt; joins MNS protest in Thane
content: Maharashtra witnessed a clash between political factions and the state government as a Marathi rally in Mira Road was denied permission, sparking protests. Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik criticized the decision and joined the demonstration, defying potential arrest. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis condemned the MNS for disregarding police instructions, emphasizing the importance of following protocol for public safety and traffic management.

title: Aamir says he's already married to Gauri Spratt in his heart: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Bobby Darling revealed John Abraham ghosted her, while Aamir Khan confirmed his Mahabharat project with fresh faces starting in August. Khan also expressed he feels married to Gauri Spratt in his heart. Anurag Basu remains hopeful about his Kishore Kumar biopic, and Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana has already generated ₹1,000 crore in market value with just its first look.

title: 'Cricket not as intimidating as ...': Kohli on Wimbledon experience - Watch
content: Virat Kohli, attending Wimbledon, expressed that playing cricket, even in packed stadiums, is less intimidating than competing on Wimbledon's Centre Court. He highlighted the immense pressure tennis players face, especially in crucial matches and praised their composure, fitness, and mental fortitude. Kohli drew parallels to the India-Pakistan World Cup games, acknowledging the intense pressure in both sports.

title: CBI busts cyber fraud syndicate: UK, Australia citizens targeted; key operative arrested in Noida
content: The CBI, under Operation Chakra-V, dismantled a cybercrime syndicate in Noida, arresting Nishant Walia of FirstIdea. The group allegedly defrauded UK and Australian citizens through tech support scams, posing as representatives from companies like Microsoft. Raids uncovered a fake call center and evidence of international collaboration, highlighting the global reach of cybercrime.

title: 'Many of you will be future astronauts': Shubhanshu Shukla speaks to students from ISS
content: During his ISS mission, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla connected with students from Meghalaya and Assam via Ham radio from NESAC, Shillong. He addressed their questions about life in space, training, and health in microgravity, highlighting the challenges of adapting to weightlessness and the importance of exercise and teamwork. Shukla also discussed the role of robotics in assisting astronauts with their tasks.

title: Ranking all 32 NFL teams based on WR, RB and TE talent: Who's No. 1? Who's No. 32?
content: Which teams have the best skill position talent around their quarterback? We stacked all 32 from worst to first.

title: Sources: AD had surgery to fix detached retina
content: Anthony Davis underwent a procedure to repair a detached retina that he suffered during the season, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania. Davis is expected to be ready for training camp.

title: Fever's Clark expects to return Wed. from injury
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark said she expects to return to WNBA action on Wednesday against the Valkyries after missing the past five games with a left groin injury.

title: Burrow: Home burglary altered Batmobile plans
content: Bengals QB Joe Burrow said on the latest season of the Netflix show "Quarterback," released Tuesday, that last December's home burglary made him change his mind about purchasing a replica Batmobile.

title: Ex-Cowboys TE, civil rights advocate Norman dies
content: Pettis Norman, a tight end on the football field and a civil rights advocate off of it, has died. He was 86.

title: Big 12's Yormark 'doubling down' on 5+11 model
content: To open Big 12 media days, commissioner Brett Yormark said Tuesday that he is "doubling down" on the potential 5+11 CFP format.

title: Cousins felt 'misled' after Falcons drafted Penix
content: QB Kirk Cousins said in an episode of the Netflix series "Quarterback," which premiered Tuesday, that he felt "a little bit misled" when the Falcons drafted Michael Penix Jr. in the first round of the 2024 draft.

title: Yanks moving Chisholm back to 2B after 3B stint
content: Yankees All-Star Jazz Chisholm Jr., after making 28 starts in a row at third base, is moving back to second base, manager Aaron Boone confirmed.

title: NHL, PA extend CBA, with 84 games, through '30
content: The NHL and NHL Players' Association have ratified their four-year extension of the CBA, which includes an 84-game regular season, through 2030.

title: Free agency superlatives: Best, worst, underrated moves
content: Which deals will impact the title race? Which will leave teams in regret by Christmas? Insiders make their picks.

title: Club World Cup semifinal live updates: Fluminense vs. Chelsea
content: Enjoy live updates and instant analysis from the Club World Cup semifinal between Fluminense and Chelsea on Tuesday.

title: Potential MLB trade proposals for Paul Skenes, Ronald Acuña Jr. and Byron Buxton
content: You won't be seeing these stars available via trade this year -- but what would it take to land them if they were?

title: Power Rankings: Storm up, Aces down and no time to panic for New York
content: The defending champ opened the season with nine straight wins. But it has lost six of the past nine games.

title: Who are the NFL's best DTs? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions, from quarterback to cornerback and everything in between.

title: 2025 MLB draft guide: One big question and latest intel for all 30 teams
content: Who will the Nationals take No. 1? Who is atop your team's board? Kiley McDaniel lays it all out as draft week arrives.

title: USMNT built foundation of pride, aggression at Gold Cup
content: Spanish soccer expert Graham Hunter followed the USMNT at the Gold Cup, and he saw the foundations being laid for Mauricio Pochettino's vision.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Germany need jump start to beat Denmark
content: Germany had to come from behind to beat Denmark, but the win puts them on the verge of the quarterfinals. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: Police: Speeding could be factor in Jota crash
content: Spanish police believe Liverpool player Diogo Jota was driving over the speed limit when he and his brother died in a car crash last week.

title: United confirm Cunha as new No. 10 after Rashford
content: New Manchester United signing Matheus Cunha will wear the No. 10 shirt previously worn by Marcus Rashford, the Premier League club confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Source: Newcastle agree $75M deal for Elanga
content: Newcaslte have agreed a £55 million deal with Nottingham Forest for winger Anthony Elanga, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: Madrid ask LaLiga to delay opener
content: Real Madrid have asked LaLiga for their league opener against Osasuna to be rescheduled because of their involvement in the FIFA Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: UEFA snub Madrid over Mbappé, Rüdiger appeal
content: UEFA has rejected Real Madrid's appeal to overturn the disciplinary sanctions handed to Antonio Rüdiger, Kylian Mbappé and Dani Ceballos for "improper conduct."

title: Wales players, staff 'OK' after bus crash at Euros
content: Wales players and staff are "OK" after their team bus was involved in a collision in St. Gallen, Switzerland on Tuesday, manager Rhian Wilkinson has said.

title: 'No doubt' Wrexham reach Premier League - CEO
content: Wrexham's chief executive has "no doubt" the club will make the Premier League and believes overseas tours -- like the one the club is about to embark on in Australia and New Zealand -- will help future-proof the team.

title: Kylian Mbappé drops PSG harassment claim
content: Kylian Mbappé has dropped the legal proceedings he started this year against Paris Saint-Germain for moral harassment, according to AP sources.

title: Midyear boxing awards: Best KO and fighter, top fight, biggest disappointment and more
content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on what boxing has delivered thus far this year -- good and bad.﻿

title: Running back rankings: Who are the most reliable TD scorers?
content: From Jahmyr Gibbs and Derrick Henry to Bijan Robinson, we rank the running backs based on the most dependable at finding the end zone.

title: Why Mbappé, PSG reunion at Club World Cup will be must-see TV
content: Kylian Mbappé will meet his former club, PSG, on Wednesday in the Club World Cup semifinal. It'll be a fascinating reunion for many reasons, not least because of how PSG have grown without him.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye move for Javi Guerra
content: Valencia midfielder Javi Guerra is the subject of interest from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'I never doubted him': F1 celebrates Nico Hülkenberg's long-overdue first podium
content: In a 15-year F1 career, Nico Hülkenberg had never tasted podium champagne. That changed at Silverstone, an achievement celebrated up and down pit lane.

title: "Will Certainly Have To Pay 10% If They Are In BRICS": Trump Reiterates
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday once again warned BRICS group of charging an additional 10% tariff on goods from these nations.

title: To Tackle Delhi's Monsoon Problem, Minister, Lt Governor Inspect Key Projects
content: In a bid to tackle Delhi's recurring monsoon woes and water resource concerns, Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena and Public Works and Water Minister Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma today jointly inspected two key infrastructure initiatives.

title: Man Arrested For Waving Palestinian Flag During Muharram Procession in Agra
content: A man has been arrested for allegedly waving Palestinian flag during Muharram procession in Agra, police said on Tuesday.

title: "There Is No Place For Double Standards On Terrorism": PM Modi In Brazil
content: India and Brazil strongly oppose terrorism and those who support it, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday while asserting that there is no place for double standards on terrorism, in a veiled reference to Pakistan and its all-weather ally China.

title: Kuki Body's Diktat To MLAs In Manipur Illegal, Can Be Charged, Says Thadou Inpi Manipur
content: A key organisation of the indigenous distinct tribe Thadou in Manipur has condemned a Kuki tribes' body for issuing a diktat to "Kuki-Zo" MLAs not to participate in forming government in the border state, whenever it happens.

title: Delhi Cabinet Approves Rs 900 Crore Package For Smart Classrooms
content: The Delhi Cabinet has approved an ambitious Rs 900 crore package aimed at upgrading school infrastructure, implementing the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, and accelerating the rollout of smart classrooms across CM Shri Schools.

title: No Orders Given To Shut Down Inactive PM Jan Dhan Yojana Accounts: Finance Ministry
content: The Finance Ministry stated that the Department of Financial Services has not asked banks to close inactive PM Jan Dhan Yojana accounts.

title: Accurate Electoral Rolls Certain For Strengthening Democracy: Gyanesh Kumar
content: electoral rolls are inevitable for strengthening democracy, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Gyanesh Kumar said on Tuesday, amid allegations by the opposition that the special intensive revision of the voters' list.

title: CBI Busts International Tech Support Scam Syndicate In Noida, 1 Arrested
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has busted a transnational cyber fraud syndicate that was operating a sophisticated fake tech support scam targeting citizens in the United Kingdom and Australia.

title: PM Modi Becomes First Indian PM In 57 Years To Make State Visit To Brazil
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm ceremonial welcome in Brasilia on Tuesday, becoming the first Indian PM in 57 years to undertake a State Visit to Brazil, strengthening the ties between the two nations.

title: 15-Year-Old Pregnant After Stepfather Sexually Assaults Her: Meghalaya Police
content: A 38-year-old man was arrested Tuesday for allegedly sexually assaulting his 15-year-old stepdaughter in Meghalaya.

title: Maharashtra to establish social security laws for gig workers
content: Maharashtra Labour Minister Akash Fundkar said 'gig workers' or those who work for online 'platforms' or companies such as Zomato need social security, and the state government will come up with a law for them.

title: Karnataka Man Attacks Teen With Acid Cleaner After Rejection, Attempts Suicide: Cops
content: An 18-year-old girl was allegedly attacked with toilet acid cleaner here on Tuesday by a man whose marriage proposal she had rejected, police said.

title: "Lot Of Bulls***t Thrown At Us By Putin": Trump On Ukraine War Peace Talks
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday lashed out at his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin over peace talks in Ukraine, as he hinted at interest in placing fresh sanctions on Moscow.

title: Delhi Approves Rs 53 Crore District Fund For Local Development Projects
content: The Delhi Cabinet on Monday approved two new schemes - the Integrated District Project Fund and the District Project Fund - with a combined allocation of Rs 53 crore aimed at facilitating small-scale development works across the city's 11 districts.

title: PM Modi Awarded Brazil's Highest Civilian Honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was conferred with Brazil's highest civilian award, the Grand Collar of the National Order of the Southern Cross.

title: Ciao Shux! Astrophotographers, Amateurs Capture ISS's Flight Over India
content: As the ISS flew over New Delhi, astrophotographers and amateurs alike turned their cameras to the skies, possibly mirroring the awe-filled gaze with which Shubhanshu Shukla must have been looking at India from the orbital lab.

title: Violence In Assam District After Eviction Drive Leaves Thousands Homeless
content: Violence was reported during an eviction drive in Assam's Dhubri district, prompting the government to send in more security reinforcements in the area.

title: Imposter Posing As Marco Rubio Uses AI To Message Top US Officials: Report
content: An imposter posing as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio sent AI-generated voice and text messages to high-level officials and foreign ministers.

title: "I Stay In Delhi For 2-3 Days Only," Says Nitin Gadkari. Explains Why
content: Irked by increased pollution levels in Delhi, Union minister Nitin Gadkari, who is an MP from Nagpur, on Tuesday confessed that he does not feel like visiting the national capital where pollution is leading to decrease in life expectancy.

title: What to expect from Norman Powell, John Collins
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody break down all off the trades and signings of the offseason in the NBA, including Norman Powell and John Collins on the move.

title: MLB Rivals rolls out celebratory events for second anniversary, download milestone
content: The baseball simulator has cracked a huge player milestone just in time for its second anniversary and is releasing celebratory perks as well.

content: A G.O. issued, authorising AP MARKFED to secure the loan from NCDC on the government’s guarantee; the amount will be transferred to A.P. State Civil Supplies Corporation

content: Insulting women, using abusive language, and belittling them have become the political ideology of the YSRCP, says Naidu

title: National Investigation Agency arrests 3, including a prison psychiatrist and policeman, in prison radicalisation case
content: As part of the conspiracy, Dr. Nagaraj was allegedly smuggling mobile phones for use by prison inmates, including Tadiyandaveed Naseer (T. Naseer), a life-time convict lodged in terror cases in Central Prison, Bengaluru

title: TDP leader calls Jagan’s mango yard visit a ‘political stunt’
content: The YSRCP president’s visit to mango yard at the end of the season serves no actual purpose, says Neelayapalem Vijayakumar

title: Jane Street row: Congress says ₹44,000 crore of ordinary investors siphoned off to U.S. under government’s nose
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate questions what regulatory institutions and Ministers, including the PM, were doing while the American hedge fund was ‘robbing Indian investors’. The ₹44,000 cr. figure is only for a two-year period and the total amount could be much more as the firm has operated here for five years, she says

title: PM Modi conferred with Brazil's highest civilian award
content: The honour was presented by Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, in recognition of PM Modi's notable contributions to strengthening bilateral relations and enhancing India-Brazil cooperation across key global platforms.

title: Tejashwi Yadav accuses ECI of forgery in the name of SIR
content: Raising questions on SIR, Tejashwi Yadav said that voter’s revision campaign 2025, conducted by the ECI in Bihar is plagued with disorder, chaos, and unconstitutional practices, which are highly condemnable and dangerous for democracy

title: Convergence of interests may impact regional stability: CDS General Anil Chauhan
content: The spread of misinformation, cyber threats, and the weaponisation of digital spaces had created new frontiers of conflict, undermining trust and manipulating perception, the CDS said

title: M.P. High Court issues notice over minor’s death linked to Jain ritual
content: Petition seeks ban on Santhara for minors and mentally ill; parents, NHRC, and governments asked to respond

title: BJP fact-finding team seeks independent probe into Kolkata law student rape case
content: Party submits report to J.P. Nadda, alleges tampering of victim’s complaint; calls for Mamata Banerjee to take responsibility

title: Centre says several unions backed off from strike; Unions refute claim, say Centre’s trying to intimidate workers
content: A source in the Union Labour Ministry claims 213 unions have informed the Ministry that they will not participate in the strike, called by 10 Central Trade Unions over a 17-point demand charter, including scrapping of the four Labour Codes. The Unions say though many unions have not given strike notices, the workers will take part in the strike

title: Accused in two terror attacks in India used online payment services, e-commerce platforms, VPNs: terror financing watchdog’s report
content: The global money laundering and terrorist financing watchdog cites the ‘lone actor’ attack on security personnel at at Gorakhnath Temple in Uttar Pradesh on April 3, 2022, and the Pulwama suicide-bomb attack in February 2019 which killed 40 CRPF personnel

title: NGO asks SC to take judicial notice of lawyers withdrawing consent to become HC judges due to government delay, segregation
content: The statement asked what the point of rigorous interviews and background checks by the SC Collegium was when the government would eventually delay appointments for unknown reasons or ‘pick and choose’ names

title: EPFO to complete process of crediting interest for FY25 this week: Minister
content: For the current year, the Central Government’s approval to credit interest at 8.25% on EPF accumulations came on May 22, 2025

title: BJP demands apology from Kharge over remarks on President Murmu
content: Congress accused of “anti-tribal and anti-Dalit mindset”; BJP says President’s office insulted by party chief’s comments

title: Bike taxi riders urge Karnataka to adopt central guidelines
content: The Centre has permitted ride-hailing platforms to include “non-transport motorcycles” under their services in its updated guidelines for taxi aggregators, even as states like Karnataka continue to enforce a ban on bike taxis.

title: Guntur will be made a poverty-free district through P4, says Minister
content: Kandula Durgesh directs officials and elected representatives to intensify outreach of welfare schemes and ensure timely delivery of services

title: About 600 Eklavya school students cracked IIT-JEE, NEET exams, says Centre
content: Officials say Tribal Affairs Ministry will reach out with scholarship offers for them and give handholding for application process

title: Stalin mediates truce between Maran brothers, confirm sources
content: Three independent sources confirmed to The Hindu that mediation between Dayanidhi Maran and his elder brother Kalanithi Maran took place recently in the presence of key members of the DMK family, including the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

title: Bihar Special Intensive Revision: Five of 11 documents sought do not show date or place of birth
content: Aadhaar, voter identity cards or PAN cards have not been included in the list of 11 indicative documents that the applicants can produce

title: Attendance of doctors, staff in secondary hospitals needs to improve, says A.P. Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav also expresses concern over poor utilisation of Dr. NTR Vaidya Seva services by the secondary hospitals in Andhra Pradesh

title: 'On death row for murder, Indian nurse to be executed by Yemen on July 16'
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read more 10 baby girl names that mean “sunshine” 10 must-visit libraries in Delhi with a rich cultural legacy Bollywood actress’ tattoos and their meaning Genelia D’Souza with kids Riaan and Rahyl .

title: Reopening HAL airport does not excite us: HAL chief
content: HAL airport served as Bengaluru’s primary airport for decades until it ceased commercial flight operations in 2008 following the opening of the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) in Devanahalli

title: Manipur High Court asks NIA to submit progress report on Jiribam abduction, killing of women and children
content: The court said if the chargesheet was not filed seven months after the incident, it ‘should be viewed seriously’

title: Kanaka Durga temple shines in green as Sakambari festival gets off to a colourful start
content: 50 tonnes of vegetables used on the first day for temple decoration and preparation of Kadambam, the special prasadam associated with the festival; devotees from A.P. and various parts of India are arriving in large numbers to witness the unique celebration, which will conclude on July 10

title: Sattva Group to build ₹1,500-crore integrated IT facility in Vizag, expected to create 25,000 jobs
content: The announcement follows high-level discussions between Sattva Group leadership and A.P. IT Minister Nara Lokesh at Bengaluru; the proposed 30-acre campus will feature Grade A office spaces, premium residential units and world-class infrastructure

title: Tamil Nadu Open University faculty protest against additional teaching duty at other colleges
content: They say the TNOU only has 37 faculty for its 32 departments against a sanctioned strength of 105, and the additional responsibilities will only add to the burden of their already disproportionate workload

title: Will complete all pending irrigation projects in Rayalaseema, says Naidu
content: I have a blueprint for the development of Rayalaseema, to make it a horticulture hub and turn it into a ‘Ratanala Seema’, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

title: Bihar Cabinet makes domicile must for women’s job quota
content: The Cabinet also approved the constitution of “Bihar Youth Commission” to make the youth of the State ‘self-reliant, skilled and employment-oriented’

title: BMTC’s new express buses gain traction with Namma Metro Yellow Line delay
content: Five express routes operate between Kempegowda Bus Stand and Banashankari TTMC to Attibele, Devanahalli, Harohalli, and Nelamangala.

title: Commercial Tax Dept. unearths inter-State GST racket by nabbing  Rajasthan ‘fake bill trader’ who facilitated bogus input tax credit claim of ₹39 crore
content: The arrested, Kailash Bishnoi, had created 17 fake firms in Karnataka which have shown a total turnover of ₹ 208 crore and based on which nearly ₹ 39 crore of ITC was passed on to some manufacturers

title: Cuddalore train accident points to  safety issues at multiple levels
content: It will be easy for investigators to establish whether the gate was open or closed since the process involves an exchange of a secret number between the station master and the gateman, say railway sources

title: Vitamin D deficiency poses public health challenge, say experts
content: Next in the The Hindu-Naruvi Hospital webinar series dives into the myths and reality of Vitamin D deficiency

title: GMC approves ₹34 crore development works across city
content: Approvals granted for works including the construction of cement concrete roads, drains, and culverts, with special focus on suburban and recently merged villages

title: Madras High Court sentences advocate to four months of imprisonment for not vacating rented property
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar finds the lawyer, A. Mohandoss of Choolaimedu in Chennai, guilty of disobeying orders passed by the Supreme Court as well as the High Court

title: Cuddalore train accident: Conflicting versions emerge about what led to the Semmanguppam tragedy
content: According to Southern Railway, preliminary enquiries revealed that the gate was closed when the van arrived. But eyewitnesses said the gate remained open even before the train arrived, and the gatekeeper had failed to notice the approaching train

title: Karnataka petitions Centre again on pending approvals and funds for Yettinahole, Kalasa-Banduri, Upper Bhadra projects
content: A meeting of MPs from Karnataka to be convened ahead of the Monsoon session to convince them to exert pressure on the Centre

title: Officials inspect rehabilitation centre in view of rising water levels in Godavari
content: Review basic infrastructure and amenities being arranged at the centre to ensure that residents displaced by floods will face no inconvenience

title: Man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing wife, her sister
content: The First Additional District and Sessions Court in Davangere convicted him after finding him guilty of the double murder

title: Residents complain of rampant garbage dumping along Rajiv Gandhi Salai
content: They say piles of waste can be found on service lanes, below foot overbridges and street lights, and on vacant lots on the roadside. They demanded that a comprehensive action plan be developed to maintain cleanliness in the localities

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court denies anticipatory bail to Indore cartoonist over ‘derogatory’ caricatures of Modi, RSS
content: In the FIR registered at Indore in May, Hemant Malviya was accused of showing the PM and the RSS in an ‘undignified manner’, maligning the image of the outfit, disturbing communal harmony, and hurting religious sentiments

title: Officials told to complete e-KYC, facial authentication for beneficiaries by July 10
content: Complete first phase of Take-Home Ration distribution to pregnant and lactating women by July 15, says Eluru Collector

title: RJD leader Charupara Ravi passes away
content: He has served as vice-chairman of Rubber Board and on the director boards of Travancore Devaswom Board and KSRTC

title: CBI arrests ‘key operative’ of cyber fraud syndicate targeting U.K. and Australian citizens
content: The syndicate’s call centre, operating under the name FirstIdea, was found to be technologically sophisticated, enabling cross-border anonymity and large-scale victim targeting

title: The good, the bad and the ugly among 2025's first-half relief pitching performances
content: relief pitchers have defined the 2025 season so far . he enters the final week before the break dominating scoring among relief peers . the lone pitchers ahead of him are Detroit Tigers LHP Tarik Skubal and Philadelphia Phillies RHP Zack Wheeler .

title: 'Tough love' coaching style prompts abuse concerns on Stanford's water polo team
content: the battle over Flacks' coaching style centers on what constitutes "tough love" versus "toxic" behavior . one faction blames the controversy on parental interference, players' dissatisfaction over playing time and an inability to cope with the rigors of collegiate play .

title: Topuria? Ruffy? Wellmaker? Who owns the best KO of the year's first half?
content: the year is halfway over, and more than half of the world's 11 championships have changed hands . it's been a fertile time for the emergence of new champions and the disappearance of old champs in odd ways . Islam Makhachev announced in may he was vacating the lightweight championship .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Who won the men's hoops transfer portal, according to Dick Vitale
content: nearly 2,700 players jumped into the portal this year -- roughly 2,300 from d-I men's basketball alone . the nation's no. 3 scorer averaged 21.7 points last year, leaving Memphis, and Manhattan, Kansas . he can light up, create turnovers and disrupt passing lanes .

title: Divisional rankings: Which fighter replaces Catterall?
content: welterweight boxer Jack Catterall won his debut by technical decision over Harlem Eubank . a cut caused by a clash of heads ended the fight prematurely . his departure from 140 pounds makes room for dalton Smith to enter the rankings at No. 10 .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: How the VAR cost the USMNT a crucial handball penalty in the Gold Cup final
content: Mauricio Pochettino says a penalty should have been given for handball . the united states lost 2-1 to Mexico in the concacaf gold cup final on sunday . lvarez's goal was initially ruled out for offside, but the referee and the VAR ignored claims .

title: ACC preview: Clemson is the team to beat, but contenders are lining up
content: the ACC crown has gone to either Dabo Swinney's Clemson Tigers or to someone who managed to beat them in the regular season . over the past 10 of those 14 years, the ac has won eight titles . last year they became the first bid thief of the expanded College Football Playoff era .

title: Should Minnesota, Houston or any West team scare OKC in 2025-26? We tiered all 15 franchises
content: Oklahoma City's 2025-26 Eastern Conference race looks wide open due to star injuries . a mass of hopeful contenders must chase down the champion Oklahoma City Thunder . which veteran-laden teams hope to stay sufficiently spry for another deep playoff run?

title: ⚾ Final MLB draft rankings: Which ace is No. 1?
content: I've updated my overall minor league top 100 rankings to make adjustments and remove graduated players so you can see roughly where the top players in the draft would slot on that list . this year's class is highlighted by a group of college left-handed pitchers near the top of the rankings .

title: Who had the NHL's best offseason? Grades for all 32 teams
content: the compressed offseason is an opportunity for every front office to improve its roster . some general managers need just a few players to remain a top Stanley Cup contender . others need to be a bit more aggressive to raise their club's competitive level .

title: WNBA All-Star roster revealed: Which players got snubbed?
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reserves were announced Sunday . the 22 players selected for the July 19 game represent 12 of the 13 teams . a week ago the starters were released by fan, player and media balloting .

title: Three years into Boehly's ownership, Chelsea's transfers still don't make sense
content: despite spending €630 million on transfer fees across both windows, the team finished in the bottom half of the premier league table . the next phase, in the summer of 2023: same thing, but young guys . this led to a bunch of signings of players such as Raheem Sterling and Kalidou Koulibaly .

title: MLB GMs tell their best (and wildest) trade stories
